name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Washington research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Washington ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Washington ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Washington research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Washington research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Washington Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Washington research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Washington Overview—4:25

  3. Follow this research study for Washington ancestors, from 1850 to 1907.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Washington Research, 1850-1907

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Washington research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Washington Resources
    ☆ AC—Washington State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Washington Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Washington Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Washington in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Washington

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for Washington.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Washington in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Washington
Additional Records

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Washington archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Washington archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Washington archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Washington Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Washington State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives site for Washington.
  3. Explore Washington Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Washington genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on Washington research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Washington ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Washington city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Washington Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Washington city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Washington city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Washington ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Washington city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Washington research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Washington County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Washington.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Washington Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Washington research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Washington Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Washington Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Seattle Genealogical Society and Library page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Washington.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Washington research.
  2. Explore the Washington research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Washington research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Washington in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Washington Societies

  2. Explore the Washington State Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Eastern Washington Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore the Seattle Genealogical Society site.
  5. Explore Washington genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Washington.
